item.title: Karen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Karen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Things are sweeter when they're lost. I know--because once I wanted something and got it. It was the only thing I ever wanted badly, Dot, and when I got it it turned to dust in my hand." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "I don't know if I should care for a man who made life easy; I should want someone who made it interesting." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "It was easy enough to despise the world, but decidedly difficult to find any other habitable region." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Maxwell
item.description: "What we, or at any rate what I, refer to confidently as memory--meaning a moment, a scene, a fact that has been subjected to a fixative and thereby rescued from oblivion--is really a form of storytelling that goes on continually in the mind and often changes with the telling. Too many conflicting emotional interests are involved for life ever to be wholly acceptable, and possibly it is the work of the storyteller to rearrange things so that they conform to this end. In any case, in talking about the past we lie with every breath we draw." -- William Maxwell

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "If absolute truth belongs to anyone in this world, it certainly does not belong to the man or party that claims to possess it." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Karen add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "A woman has got to love a bad man once or twice in her life to be thankful for a good one." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Karen add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Honey! Bring down a copy of my will - and an eraser!" -- Woody Allen

item.title: Karen add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "Maybe when people longed for a thing that bad the longing made them trust in anything that might give it to them." -- Carson McCullers

item.title: Karen add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Karen add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anna Akhmatova
item.description: "You will hear thunder and remember me, and think: she wanted storms..." -- Anna Akhmatova

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "memory, like a horrible malady, was eating his soul away" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Karen add a quote by L.P. Hartley
item.description: "The past is a foreign country; they do things differently there." -- L.P. Hartley
